backend/main.mo: Motoko canister implementing user profiles, admin-restricted article CRUD, publishing, and blob storage with AccessControl checks.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report linking admin access-flow update to affected frontend auth components and related packages.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries for major frontend components including pages, layout, auth, editor, and content UI modules.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and design tokens defining light/dark theme CSS variables and global styles.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router routes for public pages and admin pages with old notes redirects wrapped in ThemeProvider and SiteLayout.
frontend/src/components/admin/PublishTog: Button component to publish or unpublish articles with API mutations, loading states, and authorization-aware error handling.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Internet Identity sign‑in/out button with loading handling, query cache reset, and retry logic for already-authenticated errors.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Empty file placeholder for a profile setup modal component.
frontend/src/components/auth/RequireAdmi: Admin guard that shows sign‑in prompt, restricted-access message, or protected children based on Internet Identity and admin status.
frontend/src/components/content/ContentB: Markdown-like renderer converting basic formatting to HTML and injecting it into a styled content container.
frontend/src/components/content/ContentC: Renders an article preview card with title, excerpt, date, and optional cover image linking to the article page.
frontend/src/components/editor/BodyEdito: Markdown text editor with image insertion support and optional image upload panel.
frontend/src/components/editor/ImageUplo: Handles image file selection, validation, upload via ExternalBlob, preview display, and removal.
frontend/src/components/layout/SiteLayou: Defines the main site layout with header navigation, admin visibility checks, content area, and footer.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to Internet Identity and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useAdminContent.ts: Provides admin-focused queries and mutations for user profiles and full article management using the backend actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useContentPublic.ts: Public-facing hooks to fetch published articles and individual article details via the actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity context, login/logout handling, and persistence of identities using AuthClient.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables, dark mode overrides, and utility styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the app with React, query client provider, and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/pages/admin/AdminDashboardP: Admin dashboard for managing articles, including creation, editing, status display, and publishing.
frontend/src/pages/admin/ContentEditorPa: Admin page for creating or editing an article with title, body, and optional cover image handling.
frontend/src/pages/ArticlesListPage.tsx: Displays a list of published articles with loading skeletons and a fallback when none exist.
frontend/src/pages/ContentDetailPage.tsx: Shows a single article’s details with admin edit controls, loading states, and formatted metadata.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Renders a hero section and link card directing users to browse articles.
frontend/src/pages/NotesListPage.tsx: Empty placeholder page for future notes listing.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, persisting, and clearing URL parameters across navigation.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, colors, typography, and plugins.
project_state.json: Defines the project’s current scope and architecture, focusing on an articles-only website with owner‑only admin access and image support. Lists existing features, scope changes, and versioned project state metadata.
